words.defineEn: a thing or person that is impossible to improve or succeed
words.defineVi: một điều hoặc người đó là không thể cải thiện hoặc thành công

words.defineEn: the final and decisive event or action that pushes someone beyond their tolerance or patience, leading to a significant reaction or decision
words.defineVi: sự kiện hoặc hành động cuối cùng và mang tính quyết định đẩy ai đó vượt quá khả năng chịu đựng hoặc kiên nhẫn của họ, dẫn đến một phản ứng hoặc quyết định quan trọng

words.defineEn: a situation in which everything is unclear and cannot be easily defined
words.defineVi: một tình huống trong đó mọi thứ đều không rõ ràng và không thể dễ dàng xác định

words.defineEn: to create equal opportunities for all individuals or groups, regardless of their background or circumstances
words.defineVi: để tạo cơ hội bình đẳng cho tất cả các cá nhân hoặc nhóm, bất kể nền tảng hoặc hoàn cảnh của họ

words.defineEn: a situation where a small initial action or decision leads to a chain of events that ultimately results in a more significant and often negative outcome
words.defineVi: một tình huống trong đó một hành động hoặc quyết định nhỏ ban đầu dẫn đến một chuỗi các sự kiện mà cuối cùng dẫn đến một kết quả quan trọng hơn và thường là tiêu cực

examples: Their typical wake-up call is 0400, or 4 a.m.
It's a wake-up call for Our Country.

So, at 50 years old, that is a big wake-up call for a lot of people, and the very first thing you do is take stock of where your money is going today, because you are gonna need to seriously amp up your saving.
words.defineEn: a phone call that is made at a particular time to wake someone up, at their request, for example in a hotel
words.defineVi: một cuộc gọi điện thoại được thực hiện vào một thời điểm cụ thể để đánh thức ai đó, theo yêu cầu của họ, ví dụ như trong khách sạn

words.defineEn: a delicate distinction between two things, particularly two apparently similar situations or concepts
words.defineVi: một sự phân biệt tinh tế giữa hai điều, đặc biệt là hai tình huống hoặc khái niệm rõ ràng tương tự

words.defineEn: a strong urge to travel or leave somewhere
words.defineVi: một sự thôi thúc mạnh mẽ để đi du lịch hoặc rời khỏi một nơi nào đó

examples: No city has escaped the recession, but Seattle has fared best by a long shot.
It's like a long shot.
Everyone who I've ever spoke to who uses capture one prefers capture one by a long shot over light room.
In the game's final moments, Arizona missed a long shot before the buzzer to hand Stanford its third national title.
But honestly, this was more of a long shot, because carbon dioxide molecules form a straight line, with the oxygen atoms on opposite ends.
words.defineEn: an attempt made without having any high hopes of achieving success
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực được thực hiện mà không có bất kỳ hy vọng cao nào để đạt được thành công

words.defineEn: a treatment that is not fair or equal
words.defineVi: đối xử không công bằng hoặc bình đẳng

words.defineEn: a sensitive or vulnerable topic or issue that causes discomfort, distress, or irritation when discussed or mentioned
words.defineVi: một chủ đề hoặc vấn đề nhạy cảm hoặc dễ bị tổn thương gây khó chịu, đau khổ hoặc khó chịu khi thảo luận hoặc đề cập

words.defineEn: the act of forming beliefs and making decisions based on what one wishes to be true rather than on the available evidence or reality
words.defineVi: hành động hình thành niềm tin và đưa ra quyết định dựa trên những gì một người mong muốn là đúng hơn là dựa trên bằng chứng hoặc thực tế có sẵn

examples: So it's not a foregone conclusion that it's going to be Nancy Pelosi.
but anyway, this all raises an interesting question: Was the result of the war a foregone conclusion?
However, some market experts remain skeptical of drawing foregone conclusion based solely on market data.
That was a foregone conclusion: He would never get out of committee.
For us, the key focus was building a company that was going to be relevant and that was not a foregone conclusion, certainly not in the time that we were developing those products.
words.defineEn: something that is so certain to happen that it can be considered inevitable, regardless of what actions are taken to prevent it
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó chắc chắn xảy ra đến mức nó có thể được coi là không thể tránh khỏi, bất kể hành động nào được thực hiện để ngăn chặn nó

words.defineEn: a thing that is only chosen when every other option or alternative has failed
words.defineVi: một thứ chỉ được chọn khi mọi tùy chọn hoặc phương án khác đều thất bại

words.defineEn: used to state that one has adopted a different opinion
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một người đã thông qua một ý kiến khác nhau

words.defineEn: a redeeming quality or factor that prevents a situation or outcome from being completely negative or disastrous
words.defineVi: một phẩm chất hoặc yếu tố cứu chuộc ngăn chặn một tình huống hoặc kết quả hoàn toàn tiêu cực hoặc thảm khốc

words.defineEn: a situation or thing that has both positive and negative aspects or consequences, making it difficult to assess whether it is ultimately beneficial or detrimental
words.defineVi: một tình huống hoặc sự vật có cả mặt tích cực và tiêu cực hoặc hậu quả, gây khó khăn cho việc đánh giá liệu cuối cùng nó có lợi hay có hại

words.defineEn: the state in which one loses all one's confidence and willingness to continue doing something
words.defineVi: trạng thái mà một người mất tất cả sự tự tin và sẵn sàng tiếp tục làm điều gì đó

examples: The crabs have these special hooked hairs on their shell.
and I am so hooked
Both of them have a hooked bill, curved in a very similar way.
At Hooked, it's over 2,000 oysters shucked per cruise.
The leaf’s surface is covered in these tiny hooked hairs called trichomes.
words.defineEn: addicted or extremely enthusiastic about something
words.defineVi: nghiện hoặc cực kỳ nhiệt tình về một cái gì đó

examples: There was a public outcry when the scandal broke.
The outcry after The Washington Post story gets too loud.
Public outcry after the death of soldiers led to the Drug Importation Act of 1848.
Beyond these three guests, the outcry has been loud against Airbnb's customer service.
Outcry over the legislation mounted over the last month.
words.defineEn: a loud, sustained noise or shout of disapproval, protest, or outrage
words.defineVi: một tiếng ồn lớn, kéo dài hoặc la hét không tán thành, phản đối hoặc phẫn nộ

examples: I won’t have anything to do with spiritualism, ghosts and all that mumbo jumbo.
Her distinctive style emerged from her interest in spiritualism, and very few even saw or knew of her work until it was resuscitated by scholars in the 1980s.
words.defineEn: the belief that the human spirit or soul can survive after death and communicate with the living
words.defineVi: niềm tin rằng linh hồn hoặc linh hồn con người có thể tồn tại sau khi chết và giao tiếp với người sống

examples: the document purports to show evidence of the existence of aliens, but it's widely believed to be a hoax.
And that's why quantum physics is a hoax.
So clearly, plate tectonics is a hoax?
It's a hoax.
This is their new hoax.
words.defineEn: a fraudulent or deceptive act or scheme intended to trick or fool people
words.defineVi: một hành động hoặc kế hoạch gian lận hoặc lừa đảo nhằm lừa hoặc đánh lừa mọi người

examples: She suffered near-fatal injuries to her spine, pelvis and hips, and was bedridden for months afterward.
And some people I know are completely bedridden.
Stoker, who was born in Dublin in 1847, was famously bedridden with an unknown illness until the age of seven.
So, after I do this interview with you, I might end up bedridden and unable to move, literally.
Washington survived, but was left paralyzed and bedridden.
words.defineEn: having to stay in bed, usually for a long time, due to illness or injury
words.defineVi: phải nằm trên giường, thường là trong một thời gian dài, do bệnh tật hoặc chấn thương

examples: She offered to take a pay cut to keep her job, but she was just clutching at straws.

Acknowledging that a drowning man will clutch at a straw, the defendant grasped at the flimsy alibi even though it appeared implausible, hoping it might provide some reprieve from the charges against him.
In the wild, a peregrine clutch usually has three eggs in it.
The parasite is essentially mimicking a clutch of eggs.
She clutched him to her bosom.
words.defineEn: to seize or grab suddenly and firmly
words.defineVi: để nắm bắt hoặc lấy đột ngột và vững chắc

examples: We can't handcuff those folks.
You are handcuffed at your ankles and your feet with chains, shackled.
And they handcuffed him and that was troublesome.
We can't fly over to Western Siberia, handcuff you, and keep you away.
They handcuffed me and put me down, I said, "What, I ain't doing nothing."
words.defineEn: a pair of rings made of metal with a chain attached to them, used for putting on the wrists of prisoners
words.defineVi: một cặp nhẫn làm bằng kim loại có gắn dây chuyền, dùng để đeo vào cổ tay tù nhân

examples: The law allowed companies to dismiss workers without any reason.
When the teacher complained about the boys' rowdy behavior, the principal dismissed it by saying that boys will be boys.
Moving to London is certainly a possibility - I wouldn't dismiss it out of hand.
David's snobby colleagues would often turn their noses up at his ideas during meetings, dismissing them without even considering their merit.
She was dismissed from her job, which was a real kick in the teeth after all the work she'd done.
words.defineEn: to reject or disregard something as unimportant or unworthy of consideration
words.defineVi: để từ chối hoặc coi thường một cái gì đó là không quan trọng hoặc không đáng để xem xét

examples: The only thing that makes me really sceptical is that they're so small.
Nothing is fixed everything, is relative and we have to be sceptical of everything.
words.defineEn: approaching information with a questioning attitude and not immediately convinced without evidence or proof
words.defineVi: tiếp cận thông tin với thái độ thắc mắc và không bị thuyết phục ngay lập tức nếu không có bằng chứng hoặc bằng chứng

examples: And thanks to this incredible armor, the beetle can withstand about one and a half times the weight of an average car!
But glass can withstand really high temperatures and pressures, and it’s stable around lots of different chemicals.
Whether or not she really contributed to advancing the field, her illustrations withstand the test of time.
But the best stabilizer is a very healthy working class that can always correct for itself, that can withstand shocks.
The tallest skyscrapers today have to regularly withstand wind speeds over 150 kilometers per hour.
words.defineEn: to resist or endure something that is being exerted upon or inflicted upon oneself
words.defineVi: để chống lại hoặc chịu đựng một cái gì đó đang được thực hiện hoặc gây ra cho chính mình

examples: The struggles of black farmers have been particularly acute.
The last one was an acute angle.
The acute medical therapy is indicated in the exposure.
So this is an acute angle right over here.
When we cut it into slices, each of the eight triangles is acute.
words.defineEn: (of an illness) suddenly becoming severe but for a short time
words.defineVi: (của một căn bệnh) đột nhiên trở nên nghiêm trọng nhưng trong một thời gian ngắn

examples: The company's recent collapse has left their pension fund members up the creek.
The bridge collapsed, and the car plunged under.
She flopped her bag onto the couch and collapsed next to it.
She was so tired that she was on the point of collapse.
The political situation had become so unstable that people felt that above black there is no color, and that the country was on the brink of collapse.
words.defineEn: (of a person) to fall and usually become unconscious due to illness
words.defineVi: (của một người) bị ngã và thường bất tỉnh do bệnh tật

words.defineEn: marked by ill omens or signs, especially of future misfortune or failure
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bởi những điềm báo hoặc dấu hiệu xấu, đặc biệt là sự bất hạnh hoặc thất bại trong tương lai

examples: It's always a joy to receive a jar of homemade maple sugar as a thoughtful gift.
After a difficult week, I received a surprise visit from my best friends from college, a thoughtful gift from my partner, and a job offer from my dream company.
She could see the trials he had survived in his thoughtful eyes and wise words, for adversity and loss do make a man wise by teaching tough, valuable lessons.
We weren't thoughtful.
And you know, we were extremely thoughtful about that.
words.defineEn: showing care and consideration for others
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự quan tâm và quan tâm đến người khác

examples: Eccentric she may be but no one pulls the wool over her eyes.
Artistic taxidermy took an eccentric route in the Victorian Era with the introduction of anthropomorphic taxidermy.
But not everyone appreciates the eccentric decorations.
But this eccentric bird is actually a species of nocturnal flightless parrot.
Then draw a bunch of lines from this eccentric point to the circumference of the circle.
words.defineEn: behaving in a manner that is considered different and strange
words.defineVi: cư xử theo cách được coi là khác biệt và kỳ lạ

examples: -That is uncanny.
He’s uncanny.
He was uncanny.
That is uncanny, man!
Claude Cahun's photos often engaged in uncanny doubling while also playing on the performance and fluidity of identity, often in collaboration with her partner Marcel Moore.
words.defineEn: beyond what is ordinary, expected, or normal
words.defineVi: vượt quá những gì bình thường, mong đợi hoặc bình thường

examples: The Biden administration may be stealing a march by enhancing its own existing models of restricting foreign deductions.
That's a deduction. -
Charitable deductions nudge people to be generous.
Mortgage deductions nudge people to be homeowners.
But a deduction just takes it from your income.
words.defineEn: the process of reasoning from general principles or premises to a specific conclusion
words.defineVi: quá trình lập luận từ các nguyên tắc chung hoặc tiền đề đến một kết luận cụ thể
